alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 04 at 8:23PM CDT until May 04 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN OKMULGEE AND NORTHEASTERN OKFUSKEE COUNTIES... At 823 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm with strong low level rotation that could produce a tornado at any time was located 6 miles northwest of Pharoah, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Dewar... Schulter... Grayson... Hoffman... Clearview... Okmulgee State Park... Pharoah... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 221 and 234. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
